Package com.ratio.deviceService

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BTLEDeviceManager.DeviceManagerCallback  
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BluetoothBroadcastReceiver
    IMPORTANT NOTE: this receiver needs to know that the disable request was actually sent by the device service rather than being initiated by the user, otherwise it will enable bluetooth and kick off a device scan if the user disables bluetooth This is part of a workaround where we have to disable and re-enable bluetooth to be able scan devices see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/17870189/android-4-3-bluetooth-low-energy-unstable I hope that in the future that this is unnecessary
    BTCharacteristicProfile
    external description of a device profile, so once we query the device services and characteristics we can send it back from the service to the activity in a bundle, which can be received by the BroadcastReceiver
    BTDescriptorProfile
    external description of a device profile, so once we query the device services and descriptors we can send it back from the service to the activity in a bundle, which can be received by the BroadcastReceiver
    BTDeviceProfile
    external description of a device profile, so once we query the device services and characteristics we can send it back from the service to the activity in a bundle, which can be received by the BroadcastReceiver
    BTLEDeviceManager
    the device manager controls the the devices through the Android Bluetooth interface.
    BTServiceProfile
    external description of a device profile, so once we query the device services and characteristics we can send it back from the service to the activity in a bundle, which can be received by the BroadcastReceiver
    BTUUID  
    DeviceErrorCodes
    device error codes returned from the DeviceService
    DeviceService
    Implements a DeviceService which discovers/communicates with BLE devices.
